qas.question: What did the military use Southampton for during wars in the 18th century?
In addition to wars with the French and the Boer War, in which notable war in the 18th century did Southampton play a role?
What war won Southampton the title of No. 1 Military Embarkation port?
What group of people in addition to wounded soldiers from the Great War often were brought to Southampton for treatment?
In what year did Southampton lead preparations for the Invasion of Europe?

context: Southampton has been used for military <a0_0>embarkation<a0_0/>, including during 18th-century wars with the French, <a1_0>the Crimean war<a1_0/>, and the Boer War. Southampton was designated No. 1 Military Embarkation port during <a2_0>the Great War<a2_0/> and became a major centre for treating the returning wounded and <a3_0>POWs<a3_0/>. It was also central to the preparations for the Invasion of Europe in <a4_0>1944<a4_0/>.
